intro: Eritrichium nothofulvum, commonly known as the New Zealand bellflower, is a flowering plant native to New Zealand. It belongs to the family Brassicaceae, which includes mustard and cress plants. The plant features small, delicate flowers that are typically pink or white, arranged in clusters at the ends of stems. It has basal leaves that are heart-shaped and hairy, and it thrives in moist, temperate environments. Eritrichium nothofulvum is often found in rocky or alpine areas, contributing to the unique flora of New Zealand's ecosystems.
